intro: Lotononis divaricata, commonly known as the slender lotononis, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters. The plant produces clusters of small, pale blue to violet flowers, which are borne on slender stems. Its leaves are linear and grass-like, often arranged in a rosette at the base. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in grassland habitats.
